revised_title: Oxygen Use and High Altitude Acclimatization
tldr: The article discusses the use of oxygen apparatus by acclimatized men during high altitude mountaineering expeditions. It describes the different types of oxygen apparatus used, their advantages and disadvantages, and the benefits of using high partial pressures of oxygen even for well-acclimatized individuals. The authors also share their observations and experiences from the British Expeditions to Cho Oyu and Mount Everest in 1952 and 1953, respectively.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Climatology and Atmospheric Science
